MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*WARNING: THIS REPORT CONTAINS QUOTED PROFANITY*
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000963
Special Investigation Intake Date: 08/22/2025
License #: CE821001676
Licensee Group Organization: County of Wayne
Licensee Designee: Melissa Fernandez
Chief Administrator: Mack McGhee
Agency Name: Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility
Agency Address: 5301 Russell St
Detroit, MI 48211-2500
License Expiration Date: 02/21/2025
Capacity: 130
II. METHODOLOGY

9/16/2025 1:00 PM Face to Face Interview

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date about two weeks ago, three youth jumped
and physically assaulted another youth resulting in scratches to
the youth's neck and face. Staff members stood around laughing
and watched the fight occur rather than intervening. Staff did
intervene about 15 minutes into the fight when it was evident that
the victim youth was exhausted. The youth was moved off the pod
after the incident. As of 08/18/2025, the youth still had minor
healing scratch marks visible on the left side of her neck. On
8/20/25, the victim youth and one of the youth assailants engaged
in a verbal argument. On 8/21/25, the two-youth engaged in a
physical altercation. Staff are disrespectful to the youth and
visiting family.
Additional allegations received on 09/02/2025. Youth A was
previously assaulted by another youth. Youth A was moved off the
pod and then moved back to the same pod. On 08/31/2025
unknown youth threw urine on Youth A, argued with Youth A, and
then they eventually fought. It was reported that the staff waited
15 to 20 minutes before intervening and Youth A was not allowed
to shower until 9/1/2025.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed on-site by Consultant 1 in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth A initially denied remembering a
recent fight, however recalled there were fights towards the end of
July, 2025. Youth A reported she was sitting at a table on pod 2D
reading when Youth C came up and hit her in the head and then
other youth joined in and started hitting her too. Youth A said
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D, hit her. Youth A reported they
attacked her because they were mad at her due to thinking she
accused the group of them of doing something inappropriate
together in the bathroom. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
were present. Youth A reported Staff 2 called supervisors and
called a code trying to get in between her and the other youth who
were attacking her. Youth A reported she is now on pod 2A. Youth
A reported having bruises and stated she was seen by medical
after the fight. Youth A reported scratches on the left side of her
2

neck and on her right wrist which were visible during the interview.
Youth A reported filing a grievance due to being attacked. Youth A
denied staff were laughing during the fight at any time.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility by Consultant 1, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B reported Youth A
starts drama and lies on people and will mess with people. Youth
B reported Youth A told staff Youth B and other youth were in the
bathroom together doing sexual things and that was not true. (This
is being investigated under SI 2025SIC0000967) Youth B reported
she swung at her because of that. Youth B said Staff 1 and Staff 2
were present and immediately intervened. Youth B reported Staff
2 broke up the fight by getting in front of Youth A. Youth B
reported there was another incident where Youth C punched
Youth A while Youth A was sitting down at the table out of
nowhere. Youth B denied anyone or other youth getting involved
in the fight. Youth B reported Youth A was punched out of the
chair. Youth B reported Staff 1 broke up the fight. Youth B denied
anyone including staff were laughing at any point while the fight
was going on or while intervening. Youth B reported the staff
intervened by getting in between the youth and separated them.
Investigation was reassigned to Consultant 2 on 09/02/2025.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 09/03/2025 and
no additional information was provided.
Administrator was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Administrator reported Youth A was
originally placed on Pod 2D and was involved in several fights in
July 2025 so her mother requested they move Youth A to another
Pod. He agreed to move Youth A to Pod 2A which is a merit pod
for youths that are at a higher level. He explained this to Youth A
and her mother and told Youth A if she gets into any fights, she
will have to be moved back to Pod 2D. He said Youth A did well
the first two weeks, however Youth A started having conflict and
getting into fights with the other youth and that’s why Youth A was
moved back to Pod 2D. Administrator reported there was an
incident involving Youth A throwing urine on Youth F, however
Youth F was discharged and Youth A has not had any other
issues with other youths on Pod 2D. Administrator is not aware of
any reports of staff being disrespectful to youths or their family.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Youth A reported she is currently placed on Pod
2D but was previously placed on Pod 2A. Youth A recalled an
incident involving Youth E talking bad about her family, so another
youth who she refused to identify, handed her a cup with urine.
3

Youth A admitted she threw the urine on Youth F, and they got
into a physical altercation. Youth A reported Staff 4 immediately
intervened and separated them. She denied staff did not intervene
for 15 to 20 minutes. She reported she did shower after the
incident. Youth A expressed no concerns regarding staff not
intervening or staff laughing with the incident on 07/23/2025 and
the incident on 08/31/2025. Youth A reported the only staff that
she is not comfortable with is Staff 6. She said there was an
incident when she was in Pod 2A involving Staff 6 pushing her
head against the wall and punching her in the face. She believes
Staff 6 was suspended after the incident. (This is being
investigated under SI 2025SIC0001004)
Youth C was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist Youth C is placed on Pod 2A. Youth C reported
she has been at the facility for two months. Youth C reported
Youth A is always talking about other youths on the pod. She
admitted to punching Youth A when she was on Pod 2D. She said
Youth A was talking about her and that’s the reason she punched
Youth A. She denied staff were laughing or did not stop the fight.
She said staff members immediately separated them and stopped
the fight. Youth C reported she heard of an incident involving
Staff 5 calling Youth E, “Bitch.”
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 recalled he responded to the
code called for an incident involving Youth A and Youth C. When
he arrived at the pod the two youths had already been separated
and in were their rooms. He said it took him less than a minute to
arrive on the pod, and therefore the staff had responded
immediately to the incident. He denied hearing the staff were
laughing or not responding appropriately to the situation.
Supervisor 1 is not aware of any incident reports regarding staff
being disrespectful to youths and their family members.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 recalled being called to assist
in the incident on 08/31/2025 involving Youth A and Youth C.
When he arrived at the pod, Youth A and Youth C had already
been separated, and Staff 4 had handled the situation, and his
assistance was not required. He said the male staff do not go on
the pods during shower time, so he is not aware if the youths
showered. He denied witnessing or having reports that staff are
disrespecting youths and their family members.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 has been working at the facility for eight
months. Staff 3 reported she was not present for either incident
4

involving Youth A. Staff 3 denied being aware of any reports
involving staff not intervening or laughing when youths get into a
fight. Staff 3 said staff immediately intervene and call code for
assistance. Staff 3 denied witnessing or hearing any staff member
being disrespectful to youths or their family members.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Staff 4 has been working at the facility for 2
years. Staff 4 reported she was working on 08/31/2025 and
recalled the incident involving Youth A throwing urine on Youth E.
She reported Youth A and Youth E were arguing and she was
trying to verbally de-escalate the two youths. Staff 4 thought Youth
A was holding a cup of water and so when Youth A threw the
urine, Staff 4 thought it was water. Staff 4 was standing between
the two youths and therefore most of the urine fell on her. Staff 4
denied Youth A was not allowed to shower afterwards. She said
Youth A was the one that instigated the fight. She said both
youths showered and changed their clothes. Staff 4 denied
witnessing any staff member laughing or not intervening when
youths engaged in fights.
Youth D was interviewed on 09/16/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Youth D is placed on pod 2D and has been at
the facility for three months. Youth D recalled hearing about the
incident involving Youth A throwing urine on Youth F. Youth D
reported staff immediately respond when youths get into fights or
argue. She denied hearing staff laugh, encourage youths to fight,
or speak inappropriately to youths. Youth D recalled she was
involved in a fight with Youth A in July, 2025 and staff immediately
stopped the fight. Youth D reported all youths are required to
shower before bedtime. Youth D recalls Youth A and Youth F
showered after the urine incident.
Youth E was interviewed on 09/16/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Youth E is placed on pod 2B and has been at
the facility for 5 months. Youth E reported there was an incident
several months ago while she and other youths, who she did not
identify, played cards, Youth E was upset about the card game, so
Youth E called Staff 5 “dick sucker,” and that’s when Staff 5 called
Youth E “Bitch.”
Youth F had been discharged from the facility. Administrator
provided contact information for Youth F. An attempt was made to
contact Youth F, however the only number provided was
disconnected.
Staff 5 was interviewed at the facility on 09/16/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 5 reported she is a
5

Recreation Leader. Staff 5 recalled an incident regarding Youth E
cursing during a card game activity, therefore Youth 5 lost the
privilege and that upset Youth 5. Staff 5 denied cursing or saying
anything inappropriate to Youth E.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 09/17/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been off work due
to getting injured at work. Staff 1 agreed to be interviewed via
telephone. Staff 1 could not recall the incident involving Youth A
and Youth C. She reported Youth A had been involved in fights,
and she and other staff always intervene immediately. Staff 1
denied allowing or encouraging youths to fight. Staff 1 further
denied saying or witnessing any staff member speak
inappropriately to the youths. Staff 1 said she would immediately
make a report if any staff member abused a youth. Staff 1 said
she was abused as a child and would never allow anyone to
abuse the youths at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 09/17/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is currently on medical
leave due to a work injury. Staff 2 agreed to being interviewed via
telephone. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for one year.
Staff 2 recalled the incident on 07/23/2025. Staff 2 stated Youth A
was reading a book, and that’s when Youth C attacked Youth A.
She said Youth A got up and started fighting Youth C. She and
Staff1 immediately responded and separated the two youths. She
denied any staff were encouraging the fight or laughing. Staff 2
further denied any incident were staff disrespected or talked about
any youth’s family member.
Video Reviewed:
• 07/23/2025 video footage was reviewed (note: video has no
audio). Youth A is observed sitting at the round table, Youth
C walks up to Youth A and punches her, Staff 1 and Staff 2
immediately respond and separated Youth A and Youth C.
At no point do other youths intervene and staff are not
observed to be laughing.
• 08/31/2025 video footage was reviewed. Youth A is
observed with a red cup. Staff 4 stands between Youth A
and Youth F, Youth A throws the urine at Youth F and Staff
4. The youths come towards one another, and Staff 4
separates the two youths.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 07/23/2025 written by Staff 2. At
approximately 11:11 am Youth C assaulted Youth A. Youth
6

C unprovoked attacked Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2
immediately separated Youth A and Youth C, called code
and Supervisor 1 responded. Both Youths were escorted to
their rooms giving them time to reset.
• Incident report dated 08/31/2025 written by Staff 4. Youth E
and Youth A were arguing, Staff 4 was verbally trying to de-
escalate the two youths, Youth A approached Youth E and
threw a cup of urine on Youth E. Staff called Code 1.
• Medical assessment dated 07/23/2025. Youth A was
examined due to physical altercation. Youth A was
prescribed ice pack and Motrin due to swelling to the left
side of her face and eye. There is no bruising, dislocation
or deformities noted.
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Code of Ethic 3.1
policy and procedure section Staff/Youth Relationships F.
Staff members shall not verbally abuse or humiliate youth.
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention Shower Policy states
youths should be provided with toiletries, and a change of
clothes, allowed to shower daily. The weekday daily
schedule states shower time and evening checkout is from
6:00 PM to 7:00 PM.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff
and youths, documentation, and video footage. Staff responded
appropriately and intervened when the youths got into a physical
altercation. There is no evidence that staff laughed or encouraged
the youths to fight.
Regarding the additional allegations, Staff immediately intervened
and both youths were allowed to shower after Youth A threw urine
on Youth F.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff threatened to restrain one of the youths.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 09/03/2025 and
no additional information was provided.
7

Administrator was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Administrator denied any incident or reports
that staff threatened to restrain Youth A. He said the only thing he
can recall is Youth A was informed that if she instigates any fights,
she will have to be moved from the merit pod.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/04/2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Specialist. Youth A denied any staff member threatening to
restrain her. Youth A reported an incident when she was in Pod
2A involving Staff 6 pushing her head against the wall and
punching her in the face. (This is being investigated under SI
2025SIC0001004)
Youth C was interviewed on 09/04/2025 and Youth D was
interviewed on 09/16/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
Both youth denied hearing staff threaten to restrain Youth A.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were interviewed on 09/04/2025,
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. They both denied
witnessing or youths reporting staff threatened to restrain them.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed via telephone on 09/17/2025,
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. They both denied
threatening to restrain Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Policy 10.1
Physical Management Section Personal Restraint states
staff may not threaten or use abusive remarks at any time
while physically managing a resident.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff
and youths there is insufficient evidence staff threatened to
restrain youth.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
10/13/2025

sir_summary.summary: The report details an investigation into multiple allegations at the Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility, including staff failing to intervene in and laughing at youth fights, a youth being threatened with restraint, and general staff disrespect. The investigation, which included interviews and video review, found that staff responded appropriately to altercations, did not laugh or encourage fights, and did not make threats. The allegations were not substantiated by the evidence. The investigation concluded the facility was in compliance with all rules, assigning no culpability to the staff for the reported incidents.
